cards.title: Aethium Cannon
body: At the end of the environment turn, each player may put 1 card from their hand beneath this one. Cards beneath this one are not considered in play.
If there are ever {H} times 3 cards beneath this one, this card deals 1 target 15 radiant damage and those cards are discarded.
cards.flavorText: With the cannon damaged in the initial{BR}assault, the heroes headed into the{BR}bowels of the citadel to scavenge{BR}whatever aethium they could find.

cards.title: Aethium Rage
body: When this card enters play, the villain target with the highest HP regains {H} HP and deals the 2 non-villain targets with the highest HP 3 radiant damage each.
Then, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: She handed Gyrosaur a glowing green{BR}crystal. “Aethium seeding brought life to{BR}the universe. But their energies can be{BR}used more nefariously as well.”

cards.title: Artemis Vector
body: Increase damage dealt to villain targets with Constellations next to them by 1.
When this card is destroyed, each hero target deals themselves 2 psychic damage and each player draws a card.
cards.flavorText: The Meer'ago had a long history on the{BR}Council. Their Starlight had guarded the{BR}Citadel for ages, ever since the Ancients{BR}mysteriously abandoned it.

cards.title: Assemble the Council
body: When this card enters play, reveal cards from the top of the environment deck until a target is revealed, put it into play, and discard the other revealed cards. If Starlight of Oros was put into play this way, she deals each other target 1 psychic damage.
Then, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “To survey the darkness and guard the{BR}light. This we pledge,” intoned the three{BR}simultaneously, under the silent stares{BR}of a hundred Nightlore agents.

cards.title: Citadel Garrison
body: At the start of the environment turn, this card deals the hero target with the second highest HP {H + 1} radiant damage.
Then, if Starlight of Oros and Aethium Cannon are in play, discard 2 cards from beneath Aethium Cannon.
cards.flavorText: “You rely on this errant religion and{BR}ancient technology without having the{BR}first clue where they come from,” said{BR}Oros, as the automaton turned on them.

cards.title: Gravity Fluctuation
body: When this card enters play, it deals each hero with more than 3 cards in their hand 2 irreducible melee damage. One hero that was dealt no damage this way may deal 1 target 3 melee damage.
Reduce all damage dealt by 1.
At the start of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: Sky-scraper slammed into what had{BR}previously been the corridor ceiling,{BR}while Impact remained completely{BR}unaffected by the twisting gravity.

cards.title: Lonely Calling
body: Players may not play cards that share a keyword with the last hero card that entered play.
At the start of the environment turn, if no hero cards entered play this round, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: Only one representative is called to{BR}serve from each Council world. A great{BR}honor for those chosen; but a great{BR}sacrifice as well.

cards.title: Rogue Constellation
body: When this card enters play, move it next to the villain target with the highest HP. Then, play the top card of the environment deck.
If the target next to this card leaves play, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: Councilor Artemis Vector carefully{BR}considered the datamap. “The stars that{BR}have gone dark form a pattern.” Just{BR}then, the Citadel sirens began to blare.

cards.title: Starlight of Noome
cards.body: At the end of the environment turn, select the 2 non-environment targets with the lowest HP. This card deals 1 of those targets 2 melee damage, and the other target regains 2 HP.
cards.flavorText: The Arborean let out a low, sonorous{BR}“Noooome”, as she walked past. “Even{BR}Nightlore translators have some{BR}trouble with her,” explained Dr. McLear.

cards.title: Starlight of Oros
body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals each hero target 2 infernal damage and each other environment target 2 psychic damage.
Then, each villain target next to a Constellation regains {H} HP.
cards.flavorText: “The void consumes all starlight,” said{BR}the newcomer, as she stepped through{BR}the shattered bulkhead. “Soon you'll see{BR}that as I did.”

cards.title: Starlight of Zzeck
body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals the villain target with the lowest HP 3 toxic damage.
Then, if Aethium Cannon is in play, put the top card of 1 hero deck beneath it.
cards.flavorText: “They said something about being under{BR}attack,” said the Nightlore mechanic{BR}absent-mindedly. “I wasn’t really paying{BR}attention. There are things to fix.”

cards.title: Talin Brosk
body: At the end of the environment turn, this card deals 1 other target 3 sonic damage.
Increase damage dealt by a target damaged this way by 1 until the start of the next environment turn.
cards.flavorText: “Come on you Piunean maggots, do you{BR}want to stargaze forever?!” shouted the{BR}citadel's weapons trainer, as Gyrosaur{BR}backed slowly away from her aunt.

cards.title: Urgent Mission
body: Play this card next to the hero with the highest HP. Targets in this play area cannot deal damage and are immune to damage dealt by environment cards.
At the start of the environment turn, this player draws 2 cards. Then, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “We have located our missing agent,{BR}trapped aboard the ship of an{BR}intergalactic criminal. You three must{BR}rescue her. Time is of the essence.”

cards.title: Warp Bridge
body: At the end of the environment turn, select 1 non-character card in play other than this one and shuffle it back into its associated deck.
If a card leaves play this way, play the top card of the associated deck. Then, if Rogue Constellation is in play, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “You don't seem too excited to be going{BR}home,” said Zzeck. Absolute Zero{BR}crossed his arms. “Something always{BR}goes wrong,” he replied. “Just wait.”

cards.title: Watched by the Stars
body: When this card enters play, it deals each villain target 2 radiant damage. If Starlight of Oros is in play, this card deals each hero target 2 cold damage instead.
At the end of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “The Earth is under Nightlore{BR}protection, foul creature!” shouted{BR}Asheron. To Cryos, she added, “This{BR}planet certainly has a lot of monsters.”
